definition: to rush/to charge/to dash/to break through/to temper oneself (through battling hardships)
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve
person who crashes through a barrier/gate-crasher

sentences.english: Ballance is a level-based puzzle game.
sentences.chinese: 平衡球是一個闖關遊戲。

sentences.english: Shevchenko went on a solo run which was only halted inside the area by the lunging Rost.
sentences.chinese: 舍甫琴科不久又單騎闖關，但在禁區內被羅斯特阻止。

sentences.english: The second part expounds the impact on the integration of human resources.
sentences.chinese: “闖關東”對人力資源整合的影響。

sentences.english: Then, the next day another shipment rushed off to Guangzhou.
sentences.chinese: 此外，第二天又有輛運貓車闖關去了廣州。

sentences.english: As you advance in the game, more planes are unlocked.
sentences.chinese: 當你在遊戲中闖關時，會解鎖更多的飛機。

sentences.english: This will restart your quiz . Do you wish to continue?
sentences.chinese: 這將重新開始闖關。您想要繼續嗎？

sentences.english: Menses " enter close " what meaning be?
sentences.chinese: 月經期“闖關”是什麼意思？

definition: checkpoint (for taxation, security etc)/barrier/hurdle/red tape/CL:個|个[ge4],道[dao4]
to fulfill one's dream/(divination) to predict the future by interpreting a dream/oneiromancy
to make learning fun/to combine education and entertainment
to enter the venue/to enter the arena/(aviation) to approach the airfield/(investing) to get into the market
imitation/to simulate/to imitate/analog (device, as opposed to digital)
to be present/to be on the scene
to ratchet up/to raise (expectations etc)/to increase (a quota, a position in the market etc)/to up the ante/(computing) to encode
